metadata.Title: CVE-2012-5638 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The setup_logging function in log.h in SANLock uses world-writable permissions for /var/log/sanlock.log, which allows local users to overwrite the file content or bypass intended disk-quota restrictions via standard filesystem write operations.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-5638` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsanlock-client1 - 2.2-2
sanlock - 2.2-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sanlock package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2-2').
